description: '''Deekline''' is a British producer and DJ of [[breakbeat]], [[breakstep]], [[drum and bass]] and [[UK garage|garage]] music. He is the innovator of [[breakstep]] music which is bass-heavy, breakbeat-infused [[2-step garage|2-step]], first characterised in his 1999 hit "[[I Don't Smoke]]", which reached No. 11 on the UK charts. He is the owner of Rat Records, which has released material of such artists as [[DJ Fresh]], [[Jack Beats]], [[Stanton Warriors]], [[Wiley (rapper)|Wiley]], Skinny Man, [[Rennie Pilgrem]], House Breakers and [[Freq Nasty]]. Deekline has also had notable collaborations with British electronic music producers [[Ed Solo]] and Wizard. In 2011, he opened up his online clothing store, Bass Boutique.{{citation needed|date=January 2014}}
